properties.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 13 at 5:59AM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST
SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER.

THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN SALT LAKE CITY HAS
CONTINUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH.

* TIMING...IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MST THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST
TUESDAY.

* AFFECTED AREA...THE BEAR RIVER RANGE IN SOUTHEAST IDAHO.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...THE AVALANCHE DANGER FOR THE WATCH AREA WILL
RISE TO HIGH TONIGHT WITH VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS
LIKELY ON TUESDAY.

* REASON/IMPACTS...HEAVY SNOW COMBINED WITH STRONG WINDS WILL
CREATE WIDESPREAD AREAS OF UNSTABLE SNOW. BOTH HUMAN TRIGGERED
AND NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY. AVOID TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE
TERRAIN AND STAY OFF OF AND OUT FROM UNDER SLOPES STEEPER THAN
30 DEGREES.
properties.instruction:
BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG
OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.

THIS WATCH DOES NOT APPLY TO SKI AREAS WHERE AVALANCHE HAZARD
REDUCTION MEASURES ARE PERFORMED.
